channel.description: Recent content in food on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
HelloFresh Logo HelloFresh SE is a German publicly traded meal-kit company based in Berlin, Germany. It is the largest meal-kit provider in the United States, and also has operations in Canada, Western Europe, New Zealand, Sweden and Australia. It has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since its IPO in November 2017. Source
You can download theHelloFreshlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: HelloFresh
item.description: HelloFresh SE is a German publicly traded meal-kit company based in Berlin, Germany. It is the largest meal-kit provider in the United States, and also has operations in Canada, Western Europe, New Zealand, Sweden and Australia. It has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since its IPO in November 2017. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Parle Products Logo
Parle Products Private Limited is an Indian food products company. It owns the famous biscuit brand Parle-G. In 2019, it had a dominant share of 7% of the global biscuit market but in the last few months the brand grew by leaps and bounds and as of 2020, it has a 50% dominant share of the global biscuit market. As of 2020, as per Nielsen, it is the largest selling biscuit brand in the world.
You can download theParle Productslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Parle Products
item.description: Parle Products Private Limited is an Indian food products company. It owns the famous biscuit brand Parle-G. In 2019, it had a dominant share of 7% of the global biscuit market but in the last few months the brand grew by leaps and bounds and as of 2020, it has a 50% dominant share of the global biscuit market. As of 2020, as per Nielsen, it is the largest selling biscuit brand in the world.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
The J.M. Smucker Company Logo The J. M. Smucker Company, also known as Smucker and Smucker’s, is an American manufacturer of jam, peanut butter, jelly, fruit syrups, beverages, shortening, ice cream toppings, and other products in North America. Smucker’s headquarters are located in Orrville, Ohio. It was founded in 1897. Source
You can download theSmuckerslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Smuckers
item.description: The J. M. Smucker Company, also known as Smucker and Smucker’s, is an American manufacturer of jam, peanut butter, jelly, fruit syrups, beverages, shortening, ice cream toppings, and other products in North America. Smucker’s headquarters are located in Orrville, Ohio. It was founded in 1897. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Baskin-Robbins Logo
Baskin-Robbins is an American chain of ice cream and cake specialty shop restaurants. Its parent company is Inspire Brands. Based in Canton, Massachusetts, Baskin-Robbins was founded in 1945 by Burt Baskin and Irv Robbins in Glendale, California. It claims to be the world’s largest chain of ice cream specialty stores, with more than 8,000 locations, including nearly 2,500 shops in the United States and over 5,000 in other countries. Baskin-Robbins sells ice cream in nearly 50 countries.
You can download theBaskin-Robbinslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Baskin-Robbins
item.description: Baskin-Robbins is an American chain of ice cream and cake specialty shop restaurants. Its parent company is Inspire Brands. Based in Canton, Massachusetts, Baskin-Robbins was founded in 1945 by Burt Baskin and Irv Robbins in Glendale, California. It claims to be the world’s largest chain of ice cream specialty stores, with more than 8,000 locations, including nearly 2,500 shops in the United States and over 5,000 in other countries. Baskin-Robbins sells ice cream in nearly 50 countries.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Frito-Lay Logo
Frito-Lay, Inc. is an American subsidiary of PepsiCo that manufactures, markets, and sells corn chips, potato chips, and other snack foods. The primary snack food brands produced under the Frito-Lay name include Fritos corn chips, Cheetos cheese-flavored snacks, Doritos and Tostitos tortilla chips, Lay’s and Ruffles potato chips, Rold Gold pretzels, and Walkers potato crisps (in the UK and Ireland). Each brand generated annual worldwide sales over $1 billion in 2009.
You can download theFrito-Laylogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Frito-Lay
item.description: Frito-Lay, Inc. is an American subsidiary of PepsiCo that manufactures, markets, and sells corn chips, potato chips, and other snack foods. The primary snack food brands produced under the Frito-Lay name include Fritos corn chips, Cheetos cheese-flavored snacks, Doritos and Tostitos tortilla chips, Lay’s and Ruffles potato chips, Rold Gold pretzels, and Walkers potato crisps (in the UK and Ireland). Each brand generated annual worldwide sales over $1 billion in 2009.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Whole Foods Logo Whole Foods Market Inc. is an American multinational supermarket chain headquartered in Austin, Texas, which sells products free from hydrogenated fats and artificial colors, flavors, and preservatives. A USDA Certified Organic grocer in the United States, the chain is popularly known for its organic selections. Whole Foods has 500 stores in North America and seven in the United Kingdom as of March 4, 2019. On August 23, 2017, it was reported that the Federal Trade Commission had approved a merger between Amazon and Whole Foods Market; the deal was closed on August 28, 2017.
You can download theWhole Foodslogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Whole Foods
item.description: Whole Foods Market Inc. is an American multinational supermarket chain headquartered in Austin, Texas, which sells products free from hydrogenated fats and artificial colors, flavors, and preservatives. A USDA Certified Organic grocer in the United States, the chain is popularly known for its organic selections. Whole Foods has 500 stores in North America and seven in the United Kingdom as of March 4, 2019. On August 23, 2017, it was reported that the Federal Trade Commission had approved a merger between Amazon and Whole Foods Market; the deal was closed on August 28, 2017.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Heinz Logo
The H. J. Heinz Company, better known as Heinz, is an American food processing company headquartered at One PPG Place in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, part of the Kraft Heinz Company. The company was founded by Henry John Heinz in 1869. Heinz manufactures thousands of food products in plants on six continents, and markets these products in more than 200 countries and territories. The company claims to have 150 number-one or number-two brands worldwide.
You can download theHeinzlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Heinz
item.description: The H. J. Heinz Company, better known as Heinz, is an American food processing company headquartered at One PPG Place in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, part of the Kraft Heinz Company. The company was founded by Henry John Heinz in 1869. Heinz manufactures thousands of food products in plants on six continents, and markets these products in more than 200 countries and territories. The company claims to have 150 number-one or number-two brands worldwide.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Kirin Company Logo
Kirin Company, Limited is an integrated beverages company. It is a subsidiary of Kirin Holdings Company, Limited. Its major operating units include Kirin Brewery Company, Limited, Mercian Corporation and Kirin Beverages Company, Limited. Kirin is a member of the Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) keiretsu. Source
You can download theKirinlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Kirin
item.description: Kirin Company, Limited is an integrated beverages company. It is a subsidiary of Kirin Holdings Company, Limited. Its major operating units include Kirin Brewery Company, Limited, Mercian Corporation and Kirin Beverages Company, Limited. Kirin is a member of the Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) keiretsu. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Lotte Corporation Logo
Lotte Corporation (Korean: 롯데 그룹 lotte geurup) is a South Korean multinational conglomerate. Lotte began its history on June 28, 1948, by Korean businessman Shin Kyuk-ho in Tokyo. Shin expanded Lotte to his ancestral country, South Korea, with the establishment of Lotte Confectionery in Seoul on April 3, 1967. Lotte eventually grew to become South Korea’s fifth largest business conglomerate. Source
You can download theLottelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Lotte
item.description: Lotte Corporation (Korean: 롯데 그룹 lotte geurup) is a South Korean multinational conglomerate. Lotte began its history on June 28, 1948, by Korean businessman Shin Kyuk-ho in Tokyo. Shin expanded Lotte to his ancestral country, South Korea, with the establishment of Lotte Confectionery in Seoul on April 3, 1967. Lotte eventually grew to become South Korea’s fifth largest business conglomerate. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Tyson Foods, Inc. Logo
Tyson Foods, Inc. is an American multinational corporation based in Springdale, Arkansas, that operates in the food industry. The company is the world’s second largest processor and marketer of chicken, beef, and pork after JBS S.A. and annually exports the largest percentage of beef out of the United States. Together with its subsidiaries, it operates major food brands, including Jimmy Dean, Hillshire Farm, Sara Lee, Ball Park, Wright Brand, Aidells, and State Fair.
You can download theTysonlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Tyson
item.description: Tyson Foods, Inc. is an American multinational corporation based in Springdale, Arkansas, that operates in the food industry. The company is the world’s second largest processor and marketer of chicken, beef, and pork after JBS S.A. and annually exports the largest percentage of beef out of the United States. Together with its subsidiaries, it operates major food brands, including Jimmy Dean, Hillshire Farm, Sara Lee, Ball Park, Wright Brand, Aidells, and State Fair.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Yum! Brands, Inc. Logo
Yum! Brands, Inc., or Yum! and formerly Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc., is an American fast food company. A Fortune 500 corporation, Yum! operates the brands Taco Bell, KFC, Pizza Hut, and WingStreet worldwide, except in China, where the brands are operated by a separate company, Yum China. Prior to 2011, Yum! owned Long John Silver’s and A&W Restaurants. Source
You can download theYum! Brandslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Yum! Brands
item.description: Yum! Brands, Inc., or Yum! and formerly Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc., is an American fast food company. A Fortune 500 corporation, Yum! operates the brands Taco Bell, KFC, Pizza Hut, and WingStreet worldwide, except in China, where the brands are operated by a separate company, Yum China. Prior to 2011, Yum! owned Long John Silver’s and A&W Restaurants. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Chobani Logo
Chobani is an American dairy processor specializing in strained yogurt. The company was founded in 2005 when Hamdi Ulukaya bought a plant in the town of South Edmeston, New York, that was being closed by Kraft Foods. Ulukaya hired several of the former Kraft employees as well as a “yogurt master” and launched his brand in 2007. Source Source
You can download theChobanilogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Chobani
item.description: Chobani is an American dairy processor specializing in strained yogurt. The company was founded in 2005 when Hamdi Ulukaya bought a plant in the town of South Edmeston, New York, that was being closed by Kraft Foods. Ulukaya hired several of the former Kraft employees as well as a “yogurt master” and launched his brand in 2007. Source Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Danone Logo
Danone S.A. is a French multinational food-products corporation based in Paris and founded in Barcelona, Spain. The company is listed on Euronext Paris where it is a component of the CAC 40 stock market index. Some of the company’s products are branded Dannon in the United States. Source
You can download theDanonelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Danone
item.description: Danone S.A. is a French multinational food-products corporation based in Paris and founded in Barcelona, Spain. The company is listed on Euronext Paris where it is a component of the CAC 40 stock market index. Some of the company’s products are branded Dannon in the United States. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Kellogg’s Logo
The Kellogg Company, doing business as Kellogg’s, is an American multinational food manufacturing company headquartered in Battle Creek, Michigan, United States. Kellogg’s produces cereal and convenience foods, including cookies, crackers, and toaster pastries and markets their products by several well known brands including Corn Flakes, Frosted Flakes, Keebler, Pringles, Eggo, and Cheez-It. Kellogg’s mission statement is “Nourishing families so they can flourish and thrive.” Source
You can download theKelloggslogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Kelloggs
item.description: The Kellogg Company, doing business as Kellogg’s, is an American multinational food manufacturing company headquartered in Battle Creek, Michigan, United States. Kellogg’s produces cereal and convenience foods, including cookies, crackers, and toaster pastries and markets their products by several well known brands including Corn Flakes, Frosted Flakes, Keebler, Pringles, Eggo, and Cheez-It. Kellogg’s mission statement is “Nourishing families so they can flourish and thrive.” Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
 Nestlé Logo
Nestlé S.A. is a Swiss multinational food and drink company headquartered in Vevey, Vaud, Switzerland. It is the largest food company in the world, measured by revenues and other metrics, since 2014. It ranked No. 64 on the Fortune Global 500 in 2017 and No. 33 on the 2016 edition of the Forbes Global 2000 list of largest public companies.[ Source
You can download theNestlelogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
